intro: Aerva leucura var. subscandens, commonly known as the slender cowhage, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands.
